column16: Provide more information for the description of the questionnaire. For example: a table of the items, whether they repeat and a description of each item would be useful. A StructureDefinition has a lot of helpful information automatically generated for it as part of the igpublisher build, where-as Questionnaire does not. As a result, this type of information should be created by hand, instead.
column17: More descriptive information about the Questionnaire resource.

column16: The XML (and JSON) should not show the ValueSets it uses as a contained resources. These value sets are already cited elsewhere in the guide on their own, so there is no need to repeat them in the questionnaire's XML and JSON. The contained resources make it difficult to read just the Questionnaire content.
column17: XML and JSON should not include contained resources cited elsewhere in the guide.

column16: All pages in the guide appear to have a significant amount of padding in the body of the page. On the landing page, for example, it looks as though there are three inches of un-used space on the right side of the body. Suggest reducing the body padding/margins to make use of the most amount of screen property.
The "questionnaire-allowedProfile" extension is only applied to the top-level Questionnaire.item, but should be allowed on any Questionnaire.item, Questionnaire.item.item, etc. in the hierarchy.
column17: Allow extension on all Questionnaire.item in tree

column16: The Questionnaire instance should explicitly conform to the hai-report-questionnaire profile. Ex: add a <meta> tag with a <profile> to indiciate explicit conformance to the profile.
column17: Questionnaire instance exlpicit conformance to profile

column16: The QuestionnaireResponse instance should explicitly conform to the hai-report-questionnaire profile. Ex: add a <meta> tag with a <profile> to indiciate explicit conformance to the profile.
column17: QuestionnaireResponse instance exlpicit conformance to profile

column14: As this IG is based on the Current FHIR Build, at the current time it is not technically possible to reference the US Core Profiles and as such the base FHIR resources have been referenced instead. It is expected that the US Core profiles will be updated to the current release before publication of this IG and at that time, the base FHIR resource references will be replaced with the US Core profiles.
column16: Risk that the US Core profiles will not be ready in time for publication. This should be known by early June. If these profiles are not going to be updated to R4 in time, need to decide on path forward to publication (eg. Roll back to R3 and use R3 US Core Profiles, stick with R4 and create HAI specific profiles, etc.)
column17: Risk that the US Core profiles will not be ready in time for publication. This should be known by early June. If these profiles are not going to be updated to R4 in time, need to decide on path forward to publication (eg. Roll back to R3 and use R3 US Core Profiles, stick with R4 and create HAI specific profiles, etc.)

column16: The way that the terminology is contained inside the instances doesn't seem ideal (due to changing terminology)- need to research and make sure this is the best practice/way to go.
column17: The way that the terminology is contained inside the instances doesn't seem ideal (due to changing terminology)- need to research and make sure this is the best practice/way to go.
